dmca.title: Cease and Desist: fraudulent website on your network
dmca.body:
nc 

-----Original Message-----
From: Samira Nawaby [mailto:samira.nawaby@markmonitor.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, March 23, 2005 2:38 PM
To: abuse@theplanet.com; copyright@theplanet.com; aalmeida@theplanet.com
Cc: DC-OPS
Subject: Cease and Desist: fraudulent website on your network

ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
1333 North Stemmons Freeway
Suite 110
Dallas, TX
214.782.7800


March 23,2005
http://67.18.75.101/buttcam/Resources/logon/
IP Addresses: 67.18.75.101

Dear Sir or Madam:

It has come to my attention that the web and IP Address belonging to
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc ("ISP") has been compromised and is
fraudulently being used to solicit proprietary financial information,
including account numbers, and PIN numbers As such, this letter is being
sent to you to place you, as the internet service provider, on notice that
the content it is hosting on http://67.18.75.101/buttcam/Resources/logon/
and corresponding IP Addresses is essentially identical to the trademarked
and copyrighted material located at Charteronebank.com a domain owned and
operated by Charter One Bank, constituting infringement.  Specifically,
http://67.18.75.101/buttcam/Resources/logon/ and corresponding IP addresses
contain Charter One Bank's proprietary material, including without
limitation, Charter One Bank's brands and copyrights, without the prior
approval or permission of Charter One Bank.  As I am sure you are aware,
Charter One Bank proprietary material is afforded protection by United
States Federal and State copyright and trademark laws, as well as
international law.  In addition, it has been established that this is
clearly a "phishing" scam where the content/emails being sent from the above
IP address is inducing Charter One Bank's customers to fraudulently enter
proprietary information, in clear violation of laws, and other rules and
regulations.

According to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act ("DMCA"), an ISP may only
avoid liability for this fraudulent activity, if upon notice of such
fraudulent activity, the ISP "acts expeditiously to remove, or disable
access to, the material."  Section 512(c)(1)(A)(i)-(iii).
Please be advised that you are hereby requested to immediately either remove
or disable access to the fraudulent activity located within at the website.
In addition, Charter One Bank is requesting that ISP identify the party who
submitted the infringing material, in accordance with the DMCA, as well as
provide Charter One Bank with all site data. Failure to comply with the
terms of this letter will result in Charter One Bank pursuing all of its
rights and remedies against you at law and in equity.

Should you have any questions, please call us at +1-301-216-2582.

Thank you,
Samira Nawaby

MM Ops Center
